snippet: The standoff between the N.F.L. and the Patriots quarterback deepened as the league and the players’ union made oral arguments in federal court.
abstract: Attorneys for NFL and players' union make arguments to Federal Judge Richard M Berman in Manhattan in league's upholding of its four-game suspension of New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady; continued arguments indicate sides are no closer to reaching deal and judge may have to rule in matter, leading to more protracted court battle that may extend beyond beginning of season.
lead_paragraph: The standoff between the N.F.L. and the Patriots quarterback deepened as the league and the players’ union made oral arguments in federal court.

headline.main: No Suspension of Arguments as Tom Brady Case Becomes a Test of Wills
headline.print_headline: No Suspension of Arguments in Brady Case, a Test of Wills
